intro: Haplopappus berberidis, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in dry, rocky soils, often in desert or arid environments. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Haplopappus berberidis has a fibrous root system and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
